entry.title: Restoration
entry.summary:
Author: leatherandflannel

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,686Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 164

Summary: Out of range of Derek‚Äôs enhanced senses, he lets himself reflect on the night before as he drives. The feel of Derek‚Äôs hot mouth on his throat, his chest, his mouth. The way his solid frame felt behind Stiles as he stripped him down, as he begged Derek for everything. Begged Derek to stop the ache, fill the need. It was a fire burning him alive from the inside out and Derek‚Äôs fingers were the ice cooling him down with each touch. Derek had felt it too, had growled in his ear about all the things he was going to do to him, how his body was made for Derek and only Derek. He makes it to his driveway before he finally lets the tears fall. Sobs wreck his body, and he just lets it out, knowing he‚Äôs out of earshot of any nosy wolves. The crying doesn‚Äôt help the pain in his body, but it brings a whole new type of pain, the ache in his heart sharp and heavy.

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,832Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 1

Summary: Beacon Hills University is haunted‚Äîby shadows, by secrets, and by a series of brutal murders mimicking infamous urban legends. Derek Hale, a brooding new student with a mysterious past, and Stiles Stilinski, a sarcastic journalism major with a knack for uncovering dark truths, are drawn into a chilling web of horror. As the bodies pile up, so do the secrets, and their unlikely bond becomes the only constant in a world unraveling.

entry.title: No Graves for the Forgotten
entry.summary:
Author: am0ra

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 112,988Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 83

Summary: He‚Äôs the face behind the throne.The ghost of a golden palace.The man married to the monster who destroyed everything.Stiles Stilinski has learned how to disappear in plain sight ‚Äî with soft lips, dangerous eyes, and a body trained to please, not to feel.Derek Hale should hate him.But everything about Stiles is a provocation: the low voice, the crooked smile, the whispered secrets in the shadows of rebellion.They meet by accident.Then, by necessity.Soon, by desire.But Stiles carries secrets that could bring empires down ‚Äî and an emptiness only Derek seems to see.In a world where love is a weapon and loyalty is a convenient lie, some sparks don‚Äôt fade.They burn everything in their path.

entry.title: Copain of the black wolf.
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 132,962Chapters: 15/40Kudos: 193

Summary: A Sterek rewrite of the show, that stays mostly canon compliant in the beginning, shown exclusively through the eyes of Stiles Stilinski, unknown soul mate of Derek Hale.Starts slow emotionally, my first attempt at a story of this degree please be gentle.Stiles grunted softly as he heaved himself onto the roof, his sneakers scuffing against the shingles. Scott‚Äîhis best friend since forever‚Äîwasn‚Äôt answering his phone, and Stiles couldn‚Äôt wait. There was no way Scott was going to believe what Stiles had just overheard.Keeping low, Stiles crept along the roof toward Scott‚Äôs window, his heart racing as the cool night air pressed against his skin. He tried the window, but it wouldn‚Äôt budge‚Äîit was locked.‚ÄúOf course it‚Äôs locked,‚Äù he muttered under his breath, rolling his eyes.Knocking softly on the glass, he leaned in closer, squinting to peer inside. The curtains were drawn, giving him only a hazy, distorted view of the room beyond. ‚ÄúScott,‚Äù he hissed, rapping on the window again. No answer.Suddenly, the curtains shifted, and the window flung open. Scott and Stiles screamed, startling each other.

entry.title: Wrist Stuffs
entry.summary:
Author: Hathly

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,577Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 25

Summary: He doesn‚Äôt look over. Not even a glance. Because if he looks, he‚Äôll see. And if he sees, he‚Äôll have to deal with the way Derek‚Äôs still not moving. The way that second stretched too long. The way his hips shifted just slightly up into Stiles‚Äô weight before he froze like a goddamn statue.So he doesn‚Äôt look.But he thinks. Oh, he thinks.Because that wasn‚Äôt just a moment. That was a reaction. That was heat under his hands and stillness that screamed yes and Derek not throwing him off when Stiles had him pinned. And the part that really messes with his head‚Äîthe part he can‚Äôt stop circling in his brain like a fucking vulture‚Äîis that Derek could‚Äôve stopped it. Could‚Äôve ended it with one arm and a snort. And he didn‚Äôt.Which means‚ÄîShut up, Stiles tells himself. Stop. Don‚Äôt be that guy.He scratches the back of his neck, sits up a little straighter, grabs the nearest throw pillow just to do something with his hands. He pretends he‚Äôs watching the screen. He pretends he didn‚Äôt notice the way Derek was breathing like he‚Äôd just run a mile, like Stiles had done something to him without even trying.But he let me, Stiles thinks.

entry.title: What I Never Said
entry.summary:
Author: StormyBlack

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,396Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 60

Summary: Stiles is leaving for college‚Äîand maybe, for good. But before he goes, there's one last thing he needs to do: deliver a letter he was never brave enough to send.He doesn‚Äôt expect Derek to be there. He certainly doesn‚Äôt expect a goodbye that nearly breaks him.Years of unsaid things, quiet glances, and missed chances all come pouring out in ink‚Äîbecause if Stiles can‚Äôt have the future he wants, he‚Äôll at least leave behind the truth.And Derek? Derek reads the letter. Then he leaves too.But healing takes time. And love, the real kind‚Äîthe kind that survives silence and distance‚Äîhas its own clock."If in ten years time I‚Äôm still on your mind‚Ä¶ would you call me?"
